001package com.technototes.library.hardware.sensor;
002
003import com.qualcomm.hardware.rev.RevHubOrientationOnRobot;
004import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.AngleUnit;
005import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.AngularVelocity;
006import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.AxesOrder;
007import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.AxesReference;
008import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.Orientation;
009
010/**
011 * Class for the IMU (Inertial Movement Units) that implements the IGyro interface
012 */
013@SuppressWarnings("unused")
014public class IMU extends Sensor<com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.IMU> implements IGyro {
015
016    /**
017     * The direction of the axes signs when remapping the axes
018     */
019    public enum AxesSigns {
020        /**
021         * Positive, Positive, Positive
022         */
023        PPP(0b000),
024        /**
025         * Positive, Positive, Negative
026         */
027        PPN(0b001),
028        /**
029         * Positive, Negative, Positive
030         */
031        PNP(0b010),
032        /**
033         * Positive, Negative, Negative
034         */
035        PNN(0b011),
036        /**
037         * Negative, Positive, Positive
038         */
039        NPP(0b100),
040        /**
041         * Negative, Positive, Negative
042         */
043        NPN(0b101),
044        /**
045         * Negative, Negative, Positive
046         */
047        NNP(0b110),
048        /**
049         * Negative, Negative, Negative
050         */
051        NNN(0b111);
052
053        /**
054         * The value of the enumeration
055         */
056        public int bVal;
057
058        /**
059         * Sets the enum to the integer
060         *
061         * @param bVal The value (should be 0-7)
062         */
063        AxesSigns(int bVal) {
064            this.bVal = bVal;
065        }
066    }
067
068    // This is the preferred units (Degrees/radians)
069    private AngleUnit preferred = AngleUnit.DEGREES;
070    // This is an offset from 0 so we can zero the IMU without needing to be facing forward
071    private double angleOffset;
072    private AxesOrder axesOrder;
073    private AxesSigns axesSigns;
074
075    /**
076     * Make an imu
077     */
078    public IMU(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.IMU device, com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.IMU.Parameters params) {
079        super(device);
080        angleOffset = 0.0;
081
082        axesSigns = AxesSigns.PPP;
083        axesOrder = AxesOrder.ZXY;
084
085        degrees();
086        initialize(params);
087    }
088
089    /**
090     * Make an imu
091     */
092    public IMU(String deviceName, com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.IMU.Parameters params) {
093        super(deviceName);
094        angleOffset = 0.0;
095
096        axesSigns = AxesSigns.PPP;
097        axesOrder = AxesOrder.ZXY;
098
099        degrees();
100        initialize(params);
101    }
102
103    /**
104     * Make an imu
105     *
106     * @param device The imu device
107     */
108    public IMU(
109        com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.IMU device,
110        RevHubOrientationOnRobot.LogoFacingDirection logo,
111        RevHubOrientationOnRobot.UsbFacingDirection usb
112    ) {
113        this(device, new com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.IMU.Parameters(new RevHubOrientationOnRobot(logo, usb)));
114    }
115
116    /**
117     * Make an imu
118     *
119     * @param deviceName The device name in hardware map
120     */
121    public IMU(
122        String deviceName,
123        RevHubOrientationOnRobot.LogoFacingDirection logo,
124        RevHubOrientationOnRobot.UsbFacingDirection usb
125    ) {
126        this(deviceName, new com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.IMU.Parameters(new RevHubOrientationOnRobot(logo, usb)));
127    }
128
129    /**
130     * Set angle format to degrees
131     *
132     * @return this
133     */
134    public IMU degrees() {
135        // Convert the angle offset!
136        angleOffset = AngleUnit.DEGREES.fromUnit(preferred, angleOffset);
137        preferred = AngleUnit.DEGREES;
138        return this;
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Set angle format to radians
143     *
144     * @return this (for chaining)
145     */
146    public IMU radians() {
147        // Convert the angle offset!
148        angleOffset = AngleUnit.RADIANS.fromUnit(preferred, angleOffset);
149        preferred = AngleUnit.RADIANS;
150        return this;
151    }
152
153    /**
154     * Initialize the IMU
155     *
156     * @return the IMU (for chaining)
157     */
158    public IMU initialize(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.IMU.Parameters imuParams) {
159        getDevice().initialize(imuParams);
160        return this;
161    }
162
163    /**
164     * Get gyro heading
165     *
166     * @return The gyro heading (in preferred units, from -180/pi to +180/pi
167     */
168    @Override
169    public double gyroHeading() {
170        return getAngularOrientation().firstAngle;
171    }
172
173    /**
174     * Get the gyro heading in the provided units
175     *
176     * @param unit the unit desired
177     * @return The heading in 'unit' units from -180/pi to +180/pi
178     */
179    public double gyroHeading(AngleUnit unit) {
180        return unit.fromUnit(preferred, gyroHeading() - angleOffset);
181    }
182
183    /**
184     * Gets the gyro heading in degrees
185     *
186     * @return the heading
187     */
188    @Override
189    public double gyroHeadingInDegrees() {
190        return gyroHeading(AngleUnit.DEGREES);
191    }
192
193    /**
194     * Gets the gyro heading in radians
195     *
196     * @return the heading
197     */
198    @Override
199    public double gyroHeadingInRadians() {
200        return gyroHeading(AngleUnit.RADIANS);
201    }
202
203    /**
204     * Sets the current heading to be 'new heading'
205     *
206     * @param newHeading The new heading (in default units)
207     */
208    @Override
209    public void setHeading(double newHeading) {
210        angleOffset = gyroHeading() - newHeading;
211    }
212
213    /**
214     * Remaps the axes for the IMU in the order and sign provided.
215     * This is using the 8.1.1+ IMU axis order:
216     * - Z up from the Control Hub
217     * - X positive toward the sensor connector side (I2C, etc...)
218     * - Y positive toward the USB connector end
219     *
220     * @param order The axis order desired
221     * @param signs The signs desired
222     * @return this (for chaining)
223     */
224    public IMU remapAxesAndSigns(AxesOrder order, AxesSigns signs) {
225        axesSigns = signs;
226        axesOrder = order;
227        return this;
228    }
229
230    /**
231     * Remaps the axes for the BNO055 IMU in the order and sign provided
232     * The SDK 8.1.1 added a new IMU class, which (delightfully) rotated
233     * the X and Y axes around the Z axis by 90 degrees clock-wise (viewed from above)
234     * If you have code that was using that layout, this is what you probably need to call.
235     * I expect to delete this code eventually. Also: it's really not tested at all...
236     *
237     * @param legacyOrder The *legacy* axis order desired
238     * @param legacySigns The *legacy* signs desired
239     * @return this (for chaining)
240     */
241    public IMU remapLegacyAxes(AxesOrder legacyOrder, AxesSigns legacySigns) {
242        // The BNO055 has the X and Y axes rotated 90 degrees :/
243        // These are *very* untested
244        switch (legacyOrder) {
245            case XZX:
246                axesOrder = AxesOrder.YZY;
247                break;
248            case XYX:
249                axesOrder = AxesOrder.YXY;
250                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.PNP.bVal;
251                break;
252            case YXY:
253                axesOrder = AxesOrder.XYX;
254                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.NPN.bVal;
255                break;
256            case YZY:
257                axesOrder = AxesOrder.XZX;
258                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.NPN.bVal;
259                break;
260            case ZYZ:
261                axesOrder = AxesOrder.ZXZ;
262                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.PNP.bVal;
263                break;
264            case ZXZ:
265                axesOrder = AxesOrder.ZYZ;
266                break;
267            case XZY:
268                axesOrder = AxesOrder.YZX;
269                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.PPN.bVal;
270                break;
271            case XYZ:
272                axesOrder = AxesOrder.YXZ;
273                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.PNP.bVal;
274                break;
275            case YXZ:
276                axesOrder = AxesOrder.XYZ;
277                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.NPP.bVal;
278                break;
279            case YZX:
280                axesOrder = AxesOrder.XZY;
281                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.NPP.bVal;
282                break;
283            case ZYX:
284                axesOrder = AxesOrder.ZXY;
285                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.PNP.bVal;
286                break;
287            case ZXY:
288                axesOrder = AxesOrder.ZYX;
289                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.PPN.bVal;
290                break;
291        }
292        return this;
293    }
294
295    /**
296     * Gets the angular velocity (in default units)
297     *
298     * @return The Angular Velocity
299     */
300    public AngularVelocity getAngularVelocity(AngleUnit units) {
301        return device.getRobotAngularVelocity(units);
302    }
303
304    public AngularVelocity getAngularVelocity() {
305        return getAngularVelocity(preferred);
306    }
307
308    /**
309     * Gets the Angular orientation of the IMU
310     *
311     * @return the Orientation of the IMU
312     */
313    public Orientation getAngularOrientation(AngleUnit units) {
314        Orientation res = getDevice().getRobotOrientation(AxesReference.INTRINSIC, axesOrder, units);
315        if ((axesSigns.bVal & AxesSigns.NPP.bVal) == AxesSigns.NPP.bVal) {
316            res.firstAngle = -res.firstAngle;
317        }
318        if ((axesSigns.bVal & AxesSigns.PNP.bVal) == AxesSigns.PNP.bVal) {
319            res.secondAngle = -res.secondAngle;
320        }
321        if ((axesSigns.bVal & AxesSigns.PPN.bVal) == AxesSigns.PPN.bVal) {
322            res.thirdAngle = -res.thirdAngle;
323        }
324        return res;
325    }
326
327    public Orientation getAngularOrientation() {
328        return getAngularOrientation(preferred);
329    }
330}
